   118→
   119→  await mkdir(migrationsDir, { recursive: true })
   120→  const files = await listMigrations(migrationsDir)
   121→  const journal = await readJournal(metaDir)
   122→  const appliedNames = new Set(journal.applied.map((entry) => entry.name))
   123→  const pendingAll = files.filter((f) => !appliedNames.has(f))
   124→  const checksumMismatches = await findChecksumMismatches(migrationsDir, journal)
   125→
   126→  if (checksumMismatches.length > 0) {
   127→    if (jsonMode) {
   128→      emitJson('migrate', {
   129→        mode: executeRequested ? 'execute' : 'plan',
   130→        scope: tableScope,
   131→        error: 'Checksum mismatch detected on applied migrations',
   132→        checksumMismatches,
   133→      })
   134→      process.exitCode = 1
   135→      return
   136→    }
   137→    throw new Error(
   138→      `Checksum mismatch detected on applied migrations: ${checksumMismatches
   139→        .map((item) => item.name)
   140→        .join(', ')}`
   141→    )
   142→  }
   143→
   144→  if (tableScope.enabled && tableScope.matchCount === 0) {
   145→    if (jsonMode) {
   146→      emitJson('migrate', {
   147→        mode: executeRequested ? 'execute' : 'plan',
   148→        scope: tableScope,
   149→        pending: [],
   150→        applied: [],
   151→        warning: `No tables matched selector "${tableScope.selector ?? ''}".`,
   152→      })
   153→    } else {
   154→      console.log(`No tables matched selector "${tableScope.selector ?? ''}". No migrations selected.`)
   155→    }
   156→    return
   157→  }
   158→
   159→  const pending = tableScope.enabled
   160→    ? await filterPendingByScope(migrationsDir, pendingAll, new Set(tableScope.matchedTables))
   161→    : pendingAll
   162→
   163→  if (pending.length === 0) {
   164→    if (jsonMode) {
   165→      emitJson('migrate', {
   166→        mode: executeRequested ? 'execute' : 'plan',
   167→        scope: tableScope,
   168→        pending: [],
   169→        applied: [],
   170→      })
   171→    } else {
   172→      console.log('No pending migrations.')
   173→    }
   174→    return
   175→  }
   176→
   177→  const planned = {
   178→    mode: executeRequested ? 'execute' : 'plan',
   179→    scope: tableScope,
   180→    pending,
   181→  }
   182→
   183→  if (jsonMode && !executeRequested) {
   184→    emitJson('migrate', planned)
   185→    return
   186→  }
   187→
   188→  if (!jsonMode) {
   189→    if (tableScope.enabled) {
   190→      console.log(`Table scope: ${tableScope.selector ?? ''} (${tableScope.matchCount} matched)`)
   191→      for (const table of tableScope.matchedTables) console.log(`- ${table}`)
   192→    }
   193→    console.log(`Pending migrations: ${pending.length}`)
   194→    for (const file of pending) console.log(`- ${file}`)
   195→  }
   196→
   197→  let shouldExecute = executeRequested
   198→  if (!shouldExecute) {
   199→    if (isBackgroundOrCI() || jsonMode) {
   200→      if (!jsonMode) {
   201→        console.log('\nPlan only. Re-run with --apply to apply and journal these migrations.')
   202→      }
   203→      return
   204→    }
   205→
   206→    const rl = createInterface({ input: process.stdin, output: process.stdout })
   207→    try {
   208→      console.log('')
   209→      console.log('Type "yes" to continue. Any other input cancels.')
   210→      const response = await rl.question('Apply pending migrations now? [no/yes]: ')
   211→      shouldExecute = response.trim().toLowerCase() === 'yes'
   212→    } finally {
   213→      rl.close()
   214→    }
   215→
   216→    if (!shouldExecute) {
   217→      console.log('Migration apply cancelled by user.')
   218→      return
   219→    }
   220→  }
   221→
   222→  const destructiveMigrations: string[] = []
   223→  const destructiveOperations: DestructiveOperationMarker[] = []
   224→  for (const file of pending) {
   225→    const sql = await readFile(join(migrationsDir, file), 'utf8')
   226→    if (migrationContainsDangerOperation(sql)) {
   227→      destructiveMigrations.push(file)
   228→      destructiveOperations.push(...collectDestructiveOperationMarkers(file, sql))
   229→    }
   230→  }
   231→
   232→  let destructiveAllowed = allowDestructive || config.safety?.allowDestructive === true
   233→  if (destructiveMigrations.length > 0 && !destructiveAllowed) {
   234→    const error =
   235→      'Blocked destructive migration execution. Re-run with --allow-destructive or set safety.allowDestructive=true after review.'
   236→    if (jsonMode) {
   237→      emitJson('migrate', {
   238→        mode: 'execute',
   239→        scope: tableScope,
   240→        error,
   241→        destructiveMigrations,
   242→        destructiveOperations,
   243→      })
   244→      process.exitCode = 3
   245→      return
   246→    }
   247→
   248→    if (isBackgroundOrCI()) {
   249→      printDestructiveOperationDetails(destructiveOperations)
   250→      throw new Error(
   251→        `${error}\nDestructive migrations: ${destructiveMigrations.join(', ')}\n` +
   252→          'Non-interactive run detected. Pass --allow-destructive to proceed.'
   253→      )
   254→    }
   255→
   256→    const confirmed = await confirmDestructiveExecution(destructiveOperations)
   257→    if (!confirmed) {
   258→      throw new Error(
   259→        `Destructive migration cancelled by user.\nDestructive migrations: ${destructiveMigrations.join(', ')}`
   260→      )
   261→    }
   262→    destructiveAllowed = true
   263→  }
   264→
   265→  if (destructiveMigrations.length > 0 && !destructiveAllowed) {
   266→    throw new Error('Blocked destructive migration execution.')
   267→  }
   268→
   269→  if (!config.clickhouse) {
   270→    throw new Error('clickhouse config is required for --apply')
   271→  }
   272→
   273→  const db = createClickHouseExecutor(config.clickhouse)
   274→  const appliedNow: MigrationJournalEntry[] = []
   275→
   276→  for (const file of pending) {
   277→    const fullPath = join(migrationsDir, file)
   278→    const sql = await readFile(fullPath, 'utf8')
   279→    const parsedStatements = extractExecutableStatements(sql)
   280→    const statements = await pluginRuntime.runOnBeforeApply({
   281→      command: 'migrate',
   282→      config,
   283→      tableScope,
   284→      flags,
   285→      migration: file,
   286→      sql,
   287→      statements: parsedStatements,
   288→    })
   289→    for (const statement of statements) {
   290→      await db.execute(statement)
   291→    }
   292→
   293→    const entry: MigrationJournalEntry = {
   294→      name: file,
   295→      appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(),
   296→      checksum: checksumSQL(sql),
   297→    }
   298→    journal.applied.push(entry)
   299→    appliedNow.push(entry)
   300→    await writeJournal(metaDir, journal)
   301→    await pluginRuntime.runOnAfterApply({
   302→      command: 'migrate',
   303→      config,
   304→      tableScope,
   305→      flags,
   306→      migration: file,
   307→      statements,
   308→      appliedAt: entry.appliedAt,
   309→    })
   310→
   311→    if (!jsonMode) console.log(`Applied: ${file}`)
   312→  }
   313→
   314→  if (jsonMode) {
   315→    emitJson('migrate', {
   316→      mode: 'execute',
   317→      scope: tableScope,
   318→      applied: appliedNow,
   319→      journalFile: join(metaDir, 'journal.json'),
   320→    })
   321→    return
   322→  }
   323→
   324→  console.log(`\nJournal updated: ${join(metaDir, 'journal.json')}`)
   325→}
   326→

1→import { mkdir } from 'node:fs/promises'
     2→
     3→import type { CommandDef, CommandRunContext } from '../../plugins.js'
     4→import { emitJson } from '../json-output.js'
     5→import { findChecksumMismatches, listMigrations, readJournal } from '../migration-store.js'
     6→
     7→export const statusCommand: CommandDef = {
     8→  name: 'status',
     9→  description: 'Show migration status and checksum mismatch information',
    10→  flags: [],
    11→  run: cmdStatus,
    12→}
    13→
    14→async function cmdStatus(ctx: CommandRunContext): Promise<void> {
    15→  const { flags, dirs } = ctx
    16→  const jsonMode = flags['--json'] === true
    17→  const { migrationsDir, metaDir } = dirs
    18→
    19→  await mkdir(migrationsDir, { recursive: true })
    20→  const files = await listMigrations(migrationsDir)
    21→  const journal = await readJournal(metaDir)
    22→  const appliedNames = new Set(journal.applied.map((entry) => entry.name))
    23→  const pending = files.filter((f) => !appliedNames.has(f))
    24→  const checksumMismatches = await findChecksumMismatches(migrationsDir, journal)
    25→
    26→  const payload = {
    27→    migrationsDir,
    28→    total: files.length,
    29→    applied: journal.applied.length,
    30→    pending: pending.length,
    31→    pendingMigrations: pending,
    32→    checksumMismatchCount: checksumMismatches.length,
    33→    checksumMismatches,
    34→  }
    35→
    36→  if (jsonMode) {
    37→    emitJson('status', payload)
    38→    return
    39→  }
    40→
    41→  console.log(`Migrations directory: ${migrationsDir}`)
    42→  console.log(`Total migrations:     ${files.length}`)
    43→  console.log(`Applied:              ${journal.applied.length}`)
    44→  console.log(`Pending:              ${pending.length}`)
    45→
    46→  if (pending.length > 0) {
    47→    console.log('\nPending migrations:')
    48→    for (const item of pending) console.log(`- ${item}`)
    49→  }
    50→  if (checksumMismatches.length > 0) {
    51→    console.log('\nChecksum mismatches on applied migrations:')
    52→    for (const item of checksumMismatches) console.log(`- ${item.name}`)
    53→  }
    54→}
    55→

1→import { mkdir } from 'node:fs/promises'
     2→
     3→import { summarizeDriftReasons } from '../../drift.js'
     4→import type { CommandDef, CommandRunContext } from '../../plugins.js'
     5→import { emitJson } from '../json-output.js'
     6→import { findChecksumMismatches, listMigrations, readJournal, readSnapshot } from '../migration-store.js'
     7→import { buildDriftPayload } from './drift.js'
     8→
     9→export const checkCommand: CommandDef = {
    10→  name: 'check',
    11→  description: 'Run policy checks for CI and release gates',
    12→  flags: [
    13→    { name: '--strict', type: 'boolean', description: 'Enable all policy checks' },
    14→  ],
    15→  run: cmdCheck,
    16→}
    17→
    18→async function cmdCheck(ctx: CommandRunContext): Promise<void> {
    19→  const { flags, config, configPath, dirs, pluginRuntime } = ctx
    20→  const strict = flags['--strict'] === true
    21→  const jsonMode = flags['--json'] === true
    22→  const { migrationsDir, metaDir } = dirs
    23→  await mkdir(migrationsDir, { recursive: true })
    24→
    25→  const files = await listMigrations(migrationsDir)
    26→  const journal = await readJournal(metaDir)
    27→  const appliedNames = new Set(journal.applied.map((entry) => entry.name))
    28→  const pending = files.filter((f) => !appliedNames.has(f))
    29→  const checksumMismatches = await findChecksumMismatches(migrationsDir, journal)
    30→  const snapshot = await readSnapshot(metaDir)
    31→  const drift = snapshot && config.clickhouse ? await buildDriftPayload(config, metaDir, snapshot) : null
    32→
    33→  const policy = {
    34→    failOnPending: strict ? true : config.check?.failOnPending ?? true,
    35→    failOnChecksumMismatch: strict ? true : config.check?.failOnChecksumMismatch ?? true,
    36→    failOnDrift: strict ? true : config.check?.failOnDrift ?? true,
    37→  }
    38→
    39→  await pluginRuntime.runOnConfigLoaded({
    40→    command: 'check',
    41→    config,
    42→    configPath,
    43→    flags,
    44→  })
    45→  const pluginResults = await pluginRuntime.runOnCheck({
    46→    command: 'check',
    47→    config,
    48→    configPath,
    49→    jsonMode,
    50→    flags,
    51→  })
    52→
    53→  const failedChecks: string[] = []
    54→  if (policy.failOnPending && pending.length > 0) failedChecks.push('pending_migrations')
    55→  if (policy.failOnChecksumMismatch && checksumMismatches.length > 0) failedChecks.push('checksum_mismatch')
    56→  if (policy.failOnDrift && drift?.drifted) failedChecks.push('schema_drift')
    57→  for (const result of pluginResults) {
    58→    const hasErrorFinding = result.findings.some((finding) => finding.severity === 'error')
    59→    if (result.evaluated && !result.ok && hasErrorFinding) {
    60→      failedChecks.push(`plugin:${result.plugin}`)
    61→    }
    62→  }
    63→  const ok = failedChecks.length === 0
    64→  const driftReasonSummary = drift
    65→    ? summarizeDriftReasons({
    66→        objectDrift: drift.objectDrift,
    67→        tableDrift: drift.tableDrift,
    68→      })
    69→    : { counts: {}, total: 0, object: 0, table: 0 }
    70→
    71→  const payload = {
    72→    strict,
    73→    policy,
    74→    ok,
    75→    failedChecks,
    76→    pendingCount: pending.length,
    77→    checksumMismatchCount: checksumMismatches.length,
    78→    drifted: drift?.drifted ?? false,
    79→    driftEvaluated: drift !== null,
    80→    driftReasonCounts: driftReasonSummary.counts,
    81→    driftReasonTotals: {
    82→      total: driftReasonSummary.total,
    83→      object: driftReasonSummary.object,
    84→      table: driftReasonSummary.table,
    85→    },
    86→    plugins: Object.fromEntries(
    87→      pluginResults.map((result) => [
    88→        result.plugin,
    89→        {
    90→          evaluated: result.evaluated,
    91→          ok: result.ok,
    92→          findingCodes: result.findings.map((finding) => finding.code),
    93→          ...(result.metadata ?? {}),
    94→        },
    95→      ])
    96→    ),
    97→  }
    98→
    99→  if (jsonMode) {
   100→    emitJson('check', payload)
   101→    if (!ok) process.exitCode = 1
   102→    return
   103→  }
   104→
   105→  console.log(`Check status: ${ok ? 'ok' : 'failed'}`)
   106→  console.log(
   107→    `Policy: pending=${policy.failOnPending ? 'on' : 'off'}, checksum=${policy.failOnChecksumMismatch ? 'on' : 'off'}, drift=${policy.failOnDrift ? 'on' : 'off'}`
   108→  )
   109→  console.log(`Pending migrations: ${pending.length}`)
   110→  console.log(`Checksum mismatches: ${checksumMismatches.length}`)
   111→  if (drift === null) {
   112→    console.log('Schema drift: not evaluated (missing snapshot or clickhouse config)')
   113→  } else {
   114→    console.log(`Schema drift: ${drift.drifted ? 'yes' : 'no'}`)
   115→    const summary = summarizeDriftReasons({
   116→      objectDrift: drift.objectDrift,
   117→      tableDrift: drift.tableDrift,
   118→    })
   119→    console.log(
   120→      `Drift reasons: total=${summary.total}, object=${summary.object}, table=${summary.table}`
   121→    )
   122→  }
   123→  if (pluginResults.length > 0) {
   124→    console.log('Plugin checks:')
   125→    for (const result of pluginResults) {
   126→      const findingCodes = result.findings.map((finding) => finding.code)
   127→      console.log(
   128→        `- ${result.plugin}: ${result.ok ? 'ok' : 'failed'}${findingCodes.length > 0 ? ` (${findingCodes.join(', ')})` : ''}`
   129→      )
   130→    }
   131→    await pluginRuntime.runOnCheckReport(pluginResults, (line) => {
   132→      console.log(line)
   133→    })
   134→  }
   135→  if (!ok) {
   136→    console.log(`Failed checks: ${failedChecks.join(', ')}`)
   137→    process.exitCode = 1
   138→  }
   139→}
   140→

1→import { createClient } from '@clickhouse/client'
     2→import {
     3→  normalizeSQLFragment,
     4→  type ChxConfig,
     5→  type ColumnDefinition,
     6→  type ProjectionDefinition,
     7→  type SkipIndexDefinition,
     8→} from '@chkit/core'
     9→import {
    10→  parseEngineFromCreateTableQuery,
    11→  parseOrderByFromCreateTableQuery,
    12→  parsePartitionByFromCreateTableQuery,
    13→  parsePrimaryKeyFromCreateTableQuery,
    14→  parseProjectionsFromCreateTableQuery,
    15→  parseSettingsFromCreateTableQuery,
    16→  parseTTLFromCreateTableQuery,
    17→  parseUniqueKeyFromCreateTableQuery,
    18→} from './create-table-parser.js'
    19→
    20→export interface ClickHouseExecutor {
    21→  execute(sql: string): Promise<void>
    22→  query<T>(sql: string): Promise<T[]>
    23→  insert<T extends Record<string, unknown>>(params: { table: string; values: T[] }): Promise<void>
    24→  listSchemaObjects(): Promise<SchemaObjectRef[]>
    25→  listTableDetails(databases: string[]): Promise<IntrospectedTable[]>
    26→  close(): Promise<void>
    27→}
    28→
    29→export interface SchemaObjectRef {
    30→  kind: 'table' | 'view' | 'materialized_view'
    31→  database: string
    32→  name: string
    33→}
    34→
    35→interface SystemTableRow {
    36→  database: string
    37→  name: string
    38→  engine: string
    39→  create_table_query?: string
    40→}
    41→
    42→interface SystemColumnRow {
    43→  database: string
    44→  table: string
    45→  name: string
    46→  type: string
    47→  default_kind?: string
    48→  default_expression?: string
    49→  comment?: string
    50→  position: number
    51→}
    52→
    53→interface SystemSkippingIndexRow {
    54→  database: string
    55→  table: string
    56→  name: string
    57→  expr: string
    58→  type: string
    59→  granularity: number
    60→}
    61→
    62→export interface IntrospectedTable {
    63→  database: string
    64→  name: string
    65→  engine?: string
    66→  primaryKey?: string
    67→  orderBy?: string
    68→  uniqueKey?: string
    69→  partitionBy?: string
    70→  columns: ColumnDefinition[]
    71→  settings: Record<string, string>
    72→  indexes: SkipIndexDefinition[]
    73→  projections: ProjectionDefinition[]
    74→  ttl?: string
    75→}
    76→
    77→export {
    78→  parseEngineFromCreateTableQuery,
    79→  parseOrderByFromCreateTableQuery,
    80→  parsePartitionByFromCreateTableQuery,
    81→  parsePrimaryKeyFromCreateTableQuery,
    82→  parseProjectionsFromCreateTableQuery,
    83→  parseSettingsFromCreateTableQuery,
    84→  parseTTLFromCreateTableQuery,
    85→  parseUniqueKeyFromCreateTableQuery,
    86→} from './create-table-parser.js'
    87→
    88→export function inferSchemaKindFromEngine(engine: string): SchemaObjectRef['kind'] | null {
    89→  if (engine === 'View') return 'view'
    90→  if (engine === 'MaterializedView') return 'materialized_view'
    91→  if (!engine || engine === 'Dictionary') return null
    92→  return 'table'
    93→}
    94→
    95→
    96→function normalizeColumnFromSystemRow(row: SystemColumnRow): ColumnDefinition {
    97→  const nullableMatch = row.type.match(/^Nullable\((.+)\)$/)
    98→  const type = nullableMatch?.[1] ? nullableMatch[1] : row.type
    99→  const nullable = Boolean(nullableMatch?.[1])
   100→  let defaultValue: ColumnDefinition['default'] | undefined
   101→  if (row.default_expression && row.default_kind === 'DEFAULT') {
   102→    defaultValue = normalizeSQLFragment(row.default_expression)
   103→  }
   104→  return {
   105→    name: row.name,
   106→    type,
   107→    nullable: nullable || undefined,
   108→    default: defaultValue,
   109→    comment: row.comment?.trim() || undefined,
   110→  }
   111→}
   112→
   113→function normalizeIndexType(value: string): SkipIndexDefinition['type'] {
   114→  if (value === 'minmax') return 'minmax'
   115→  if (value === 'set') return 'set'
   116→  if (value === 'bloom_filter') return 'bloom_filter'
   117→  if (value === 'tokenbf_v1') return 'tokenbf_v1'
   118→  if (value === 'ngrambf_v1') return 'ngrambf_v1'
   119→  return 'set'
   120→}
   121→
   122→function normalizeIndexFromSystemRow(row: SystemSkippingIndexRow): SkipIndexDefinition {
   123→  return {
   124→    name: row.name,
   125→    expression: normalizeSQLFragment(row.expr),
   126→    type: normalizeIndexType(row.type),
   127→    granularity: row.granularity,
   128→  }
   129→}
   130→
   131→export function createClickHouseExecutor(config: NonNullable<ChxConfig['clickhouse']>): ClickHouseExecutor {
   132→  const client = createClient({
   133→    url: config.url,
   134→    username: config.username,
   135→    password: config.password,
   136→    database: config.database,
   137→    clickhouse_settings: {
   138→      wait_end_of_query: 1,
   139→    },
   140→  })
   141→
   142→  return {
   143→    async execute(sql: string): Promise<void> {
   144→      await client.command({ query: sql })
   145→    },
   146→    async query<T>(sql: string): Promise<T[]> {
   147→      const result = await client.query({ query: sql, format: 'JSONEachRow' })
   148→      return result.json<T>()
   149→    },
   150→    async insert<T extends Record<string, unknown>>(params: { table: string; values: T[] }): Promise<void> {
   151→      await client.insert({
   152→        table: params.table,
   153→        values: params.values,
   154→        format: 'JSONEachRow',
   155→      })
   156→    },
   157→    async close(): Promise<void> {
   158→      await client.close()
   159→    },
   160→    async listSchemaObjects(): Promise<SchemaObjectRef[]> {
   161→      const rows = await this.query<SystemTableRow>(
   162→        `SELECT database, name, engine
   163→FROM system.tables
   164→WHERE is_temporary = 0
   165→  AND database NOT IN ('system', 'information_schema', 'INFORMATION_SCHEMA')`
   166→      )
   167→
   168→      const out: SchemaObjectRef[] = []
   169→      for (const row of rows) {
   170→        const kind = inferSchemaKindFromEngine(row.engine)
   171→        if (!kind) continue
   172→        out.push({
   173→          kind,
   174→          database: row.database,
   175→          name: row.name,
   176→        })
   177→      }
   178→      return out
   179→    },
   180→    async listTableDetails(databases: string[]): Promise<IntrospectedTable[]> {
   181→      if (databases.length === 0) return []
   182→
   183→      const quotedDatabases = databases.map((dbName) => `'${dbName.replace(/'/g, "''")}'`).join(', ')
   184→      const tables = await this.query<SystemTableRow>(
   185→        `SELECT database, name, engine, create_table_query
   186→FROM system.tables
   187→WHERE is_temporary = 0
   188→  AND database IN (${quotedDatabases})`
   189→      )
   190→      const tableRows = tables.filter((row) => inferSchemaKindFromEngine(row.engine) === 'table')
   191→      if (tableRows.length === 0) return []
   192→
   193→      const columns = await this.query<SystemColumnRow>(
   194→        `SELECT database, table, name, type, default_kind, default_expression, comment, position
   195→FROM system.columns
   196→WHERE database IN (${quotedDatabases})`
   197→      )
   198→      const indexes = await this.query<SystemSkippingIndexRow>(
   199→        `SELECT database, table, name, expr, type, granularity
   200→FROM system.data_skipping_indices
   201→WHERE database IN (${quotedDatabases})`
   202→      )
   203→
   204→      const columnsByTable = new Map<string, SystemColumnRow[]>()
   205→      for (const row of columns) {
   206→        const key = `${row.database}.${row.table}`
   207→        const rows = columnsByTable.get(key)
   208→        if (rows) {
   209→          rows.push(row)
   210→        } else {
   211→          columnsByTable.set(key, [row])
   212→        }
   213→      }
   214→
   215→      const indexesByTable = new Map<string, SystemSkippingIndexRow[]>()
   216→      for (const row of indexes) {
   217→        const key = `${row.database}.${row.table}`
   218→        const rows = indexesByTable.get(key)
   219→        if (rows) {
   220→          rows.push(row)
   221→        } else {
   222→          indexesByTable.set(key, [row])
   223→        }
   224→      }
   225→
   226→      return tableRows
   227→        .map((row) => {
   228→          const key = `${row.database}.${row.name}`
   229→          const columnRows = (columnsByTable.get(key) ?? []).sort((a, b) => a.position - b.position)
   230→          const indexRows = indexesByTable.get(key) ?? []
   231→          return {
   232→            database: row.database,
   233→            name: row.name,
   234→            engine: parseEngineFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   235→            primaryKey: parsePrimaryKeyFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   236→            orderBy: parseOrderByFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   237→            uniqueKey: parseUniqueKeyFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   238→            partitionBy: parsePartitionByFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   239→            columns: columnRows.map(normalizeColumnFromSystemRow),
   240→            settings: parseSettingsFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   241→            indexes: indexRows.map(normalizeIndexFromSystemRow),
   242→            projections: parseProjectionsFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   243→            ttl: parseTTLFromCreateTableQuery(row.create_table_query),
   244→          }
   245→        })
   246→        .sort((a, b) => {
   247→          const dbOrder = a.database.localeCompare(b.database)
   248→          if (dbOrder !== 0) return dbOrder
   249→          return a.name.localeCompare(b.name)
   250→        })
   251→    },
   252→  }
   253→}
   254→

1→export { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'
     2→

export { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'

export {
  DEFAULT_CONFIG_FILE,
  loadConfig,
  resolveDirs,
  writeIfMissing,
} from './config.js'
export {
  checksumSQL,
  findChecksumMismatches,
  listMigrations,
  parseJSONOrThrow,
  readJournal,
  readSnapshot,
  summarizePlan,
  writeJournal,
  type ChecksumMismatch,
  type MigrationJournal,
  type MigrationJournalEntry,
} from './migration-store.js'
export { emitJson, jsonPayload, printOutput, type Command } from './json-output.js'
export {
  collectDestructiveOperationMarkers,
  extractMigrationOperationSummaries,
  extractDestructiveOperationSummaries,
  extractExecutableStatements,
  migrationContainsDangerOperation,
  parseOperationLine,
  type MigrationOperationSummary,
  type DestructiveOperationMarker,
} from './safety-markers.js'
export { loadSchemaDefinitions } from './schema-loader.js'

input.content:
# Store Migration Journal in ClickHouse

## Context

Migration state is currently tracked in a local `journal.json` file (`./chkit/meta/journal.json`). This breaks multi-environment workflows — you can't use the same repo to manage staging and production because there's only one journal. Moving the journal into ClickHouse means each environment (each ClickHouse instance) independently tracks which migrations have been applied to it.

## Design

### 1. ClickHouse migration tracking table

Table `_chkit_migrations` is created automatically in the user's configured database:

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
    name String,
    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
    checksum String,
    chkit_version String
) ENGINE = MergeTree()
ORDER BY (name)
SETTINGS index_granularity = 1
```

- `MergeTree()` is portable (ClickHouse Cloud maps it to `SharedMergeTree` automatically).
- `ORDER BY (name)` — migrations are looked up by name.
- `index_granularity = 1` — table will have very few rows.
- `_chkit_` prefix signals internal use and provides a filtering convention.

### 2. JournalStore interface

New file: `packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts`

```typescript
export interface JournalStore {
  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
}
```

Two implementations:

- **`LocalJournalStore`** — wraps existing `readJournal()`/`writeJournal()` from `migration-store.ts`
- **`ClickHouseJournalStore`** — reads/writes the `_chkit_migrations` table. Auto-bootstraps the table via `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS` on first access (idempotent).

Factory: `createJournalStore(config, db?)` returns the appropriate implementation based on whether `config.clickhouse` is set.

### 3. Command changes

**`migrate`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts`):
- When `config.clickhouse` exists, create the ClickHouse executor *before* reading the journal (currently it's created only when `--apply` is confirmed at line 273). The same executor is reused for both journal reads and migration execution.
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 121) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Replace `writeJournal(metaDir, journal)` (line 300) with `journalStore.appendEntry(entry)`.
- When using local fallback (no CH config), behavior is unchanged.

**`status`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 21) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- When using ClickHouse journal, creates a connection (status currently doesn't connect to CH).

**`check`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 26) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Already may connect to CH for drift detection.

### 4. New `--local` flag

Add to `GLOBAL_FLAGS` in `packages/cli/src/bin/global-flags.ts`:

```typescript
{ name: '--local', type: 'boolean', description: 'Use local journal file instead of ClickHouse' }
```

Resolution logic: `--local` → local file. Otherwise, if `config.clickhouse` is set → ClickHouse journal. Otherwise → local file.

### 5. Drift detection exclusion

In `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts`, add to `listSchemaObjects()` query (line 163):

```sql
AND name NOT LIKE '_chkit_%'
```

This prevents the tracking table from appearing as drift.

### 6. Local journal import detection

When ClickHouse journal mode is active and a local `journal.json` exists with entries, but the ClickHouse table is empty, emit a clear error suggesting the user run with `--local` or manually verify. (We can add a `--import-journal` command later if needed.)

## Files to modify

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts` | **New.** `JournalStore` interface + both implementations + factory |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/global-flags.ts` | Add `--local` flag |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts` | Use `JournalStore`, move executor creation earlier |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts` | Use `JournalStore` |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts` | Use `JournalStore` |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/lib.ts` | Export `JournalStore` types |
| `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts` | Add `_chkit_` exclusion to `listSchemaObjects` |

`migration-store.ts` is unchanged — its functions are still used by `LocalJournalStore` and for checksums/snapshots.

## Verification

1. `bun run build && bun run typecheck` — all packages compile
2. `bun run test` — existing tests pass
3. Manual: run `chkit status` with a ClickHouse config — should connect and read from CH table
4. Manual: run `chkit migrate --apply` — should record in CH table
5. Manual: run `chkit status --local` — should read from local file
6. Manual: run `chkit drift` — should not show `_chkit_migrations` as drift

- **`ClickHouseJournalStore`** — reads/writes the `_chkit_migrations` table. Auto-bootstraps the table via `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS` on first access (idempotent).

Factory: `createJournalStore(config, db?)` returns the appropriate implementation based on whether `config.clickhouse` is set.

### 3. Command changes

**`migrate`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts`):
- When `config.clickhouse` exists, create the ClickHouse executor *before* reading the journal (currently it's created only when `--apply` is confirmed at line 273). The same executor is reused for both journal reads and migration execution.
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 121) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Replace `writeJournal(metaDir, journal)` (line 300) with `journalStore.appendEntry(entry)`.
- When using local fallback (no CH config), behavior is unchanged.

**`status`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 21) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- When using ClickHouse journal, creates a connection (status currently doesn't connect to CH).

**`check`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 26) with `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Already may connect to CH for drift detection.

### 4. New `--local` flag

Add to `GLOBAL_FLAGS` in `packages/cli/src/bin/global-flags.ts`:

```typescript
{ name: '--local', type: 'boolean', description: 'Use local journal file instead of ClickHouse' }
```

Resolution logic: `--local` → local file. Otherwise, if `config.clickhouse` is set → ClickHouse journal. Otherwise → local file.

### 5. Drift detection exclusion

In `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts`, add to `listSchemaObjects()` query (line 163):

```sql
AND name NOT LIKE '_chkit_%'
```

This prevents the tracking table from appearing as drift.

### 6. Local journal import detection

When ClickHouse journal mode is active and a local `journal.json` exists with entries, but the ClickHouse table is empty, emit a clear error suggesting the user run with `--local` or manually verify. (We can add a `--import-journal` command later if needed.)

## Files to modify

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts` | **New.** `JournalStore` interface + both implementations + factory |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/global-flags.ts` | Add `--local` flag |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts` | Use `JournalStore`, move executor creation earlier |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts` | Use `JournalStore` |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts` | Use `JournalStore` |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/lib.ts` | Export `JournalStore` types |
| `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts` | Add `_chkit_` exclusion to `listSchemaObjects` |

`migration-store.ts` is unchanged — its functions are still used by `LocalJournalStore` and for checksums/snapshots.

## Verification

1. `bun run build && bun run typecheck` — all packages compile
2. `bun run test` — existing tests pass
3. Manual: run `chkit status` with a ClickHouse config — should connect and read from CH table
4. Manual: run `chkit migrate --apply` — should record in CH table
5. Manual: run `chkit status --local` — should read from local file
6. Manual: run `chkit drift` — should not show `_chkit_migrations` as drift

input.content:
# Store Migration Journal in ClickHouse

## Context

Migration state is currently tracked in a local `journal.json` file (`./chkit/meta/journal.json`). This breaks multi-environment workflows — you can't use the same repo to manage staging and production because there's only one journal. Moving the journal into ClickHouse means each environment independently tracks which migrations have been applied to it. The local journal is being removed entirely.

## Design

### 1. ClickHouse migration tracking table

Table `_chkit_migrations` in the user's configured database (`config.clickhouse.database`):

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
    name String,
    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
    checksum String,
    chkit_version String
) ENGINE = MergeTree()
ORDER BY (name)
SETTINGS index_granularity = 1
```

- `MergeTree()` is portable (ClickHouse Cloud maps it to `SharedMergeTree` automatically).
- Table is auto-created via `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS` on first access (idempotent).

### 2. ClickHouseJournalStore

New file: `packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts`

```typescript
export interface JournalStore {
  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
}
```

Single implementation: `ClickHouseJournalStore` — reads/writes the `_chkit_migrations` table. Bootstraps the table lazily on first call.

### 3. Command changes

All three commands that read the journal now require `config.clickhouse` to be set.

**`migrate`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts`):
- Create the ClickHouse executor *before* reading the journal (currently created at line 273 only when `--apply` is confirmed). Reuse the same executor for journal reads and migration execution.
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 121) → `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Replace `writeJournal(metaDir, journal)` (line 300) → `journalStore.appendEntry(entry)`.
- Remove the `journal` mutation pattern (pushing to `journal.applied` array) — just call `appendEntry` directly.
- Error if `config.clickhouse` is not set (needed for both journal and execution now).

**`status`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 21) → `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Now requires a ClickHouse connection (previously was local-only).
- Error if `config.clickhouse` is not set.

**`check`** (`packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts`):
- Replace `readJournal(metaDir)` (line 26) → `journalStore.readJournal()`.
- Error if `config.clickhouse` is not set.

### 4. Drift detection exclusion

In `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts`, add to `listSchemaObjects()` query (line 163):

```sql
AND name NOT LIKE '_chkit_%'
```

Prevents the tracking table from showing up as unexpected drift.

### 5. Remove local journal code

- Remove `readJournal()` and `writeJournal()` from `migration-store.ts`.
- Remove their exports from `lib.ts`.
- Keep `checksumSQL`, `findChecksumMismatches`, `listMigrations`, `readSnapshot`, etc. — these are still needed.

## Files to modify

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts` | **New.** `JournalStore` interface + `ClickHouseJournalStore` + factory |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/migrate.ts` | Use `JournalStore`, move executor creation earlier, remove local journal writes |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/status.ts` | Use `JournalStore`, require CH connection |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/commands/check.ts` | Use `JournalStore`, require CH connection |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/migration-store.ts` | Remove `readJournal()` and `writeJournal()` |
| `packages/cli/src/bin/lib.ts` | Remove `readJournal`/`writeJournal` exports, add `JournalStore` types |
| `packages/clickhouse/src/index.ts` | Add `_chkit_` exclusion to `listSchemaObjects` |

## Verification

1. `bun run build && bun run typecheck` — all packages compile
2. `bun run test` — existing tests pass (some may need updating for removed functions)
3. Manual: `chkit status` with CH config — connects and reads from CH table
4. Manual: `chkit migrate --apply` — records entries in CH table
5. Manual: `chkit drift` — `_chkit_migrations` does not appear as drift

diff --git a/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..2bb4f51
--- /dev/null
+++ b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+import { createClickHouseExecutor, type ClickHouseExecutor } from '@chkit/clickhouse'
+import type { ChxConfig } from '@chkit/core'
+
+import type { MigrationJournal, MigrationJournalEntry } from './migration-store.js'
+import { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'
+
+export interface JournalStore {
+  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
+  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
+}
+
+const CREATE_TABLE_SQL = `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
+    name String,
+    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
+    checksum String,
+    chkit_version String
+) ENGINE = MergeTree()
+ORDER BY (name)
+SETTINGS index_granularity = 1`
+
+interface MigrationRow extends Record<string, unknown> {
+  name: string
+  applied_at: string
+  checksum: string
+  chkit_version: string
+}
+
+export function createJournalStore(db: ClickHouseExecutor): JournalStore {
+  let bootstrapped = false
+
+  async function ensureTable(): Promise<void> {
+    if (bootstrapped) return
+    await db.execute(CREATE_TABLE_SQL)
+    bootstrapped = true
+  }
+
+  return {
+    async readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      const rows = await db.query<MigrationRow>(
+        `SELECT name, applied_at, checksum, chkit_version FROM _chkit_migrations ORDER BY name`
+      )
+      return {
+        version: 1,
+        applied: rows.map((row) => ({
+          name: row.name,
+          appliedAt: row.applied_at,
+          checksum: row.checksum,
+        })),
+      }
+    },
+
+    async appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      await db.insert<MigrationRow>({
+        table: '_chkit_migrations',
+        values: [
+          {
+            name: entry.name,
+            applied_at: entry.appliedAt,
+            checksum: entry.checksum,
+            chkit_version: CLI_VERSION,
+          },
+        ],
+      })
+    },
+  }
+}
+
+export function createJournalStoreFromConfig(
+  clickhouseConfig: NonNullable<ChxConfig['clickhouse']>
+): { journalStore: JournalStore; db: ClickHouseExecutor } {
+  const db = createClickHouseExecutor(clickhouseConfig)
+  return { journalStore: createJournalStore(db), db }
+}

diff --git a/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..2bb4f51
--- /dev/null
+++ b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+import { createClickHouseExecutor, type ClickHouseExecutor } from '@chkit/clickhouse'
+import type { ChxConfig } from '@chkit/core'
+
+import type { MigrationJournal, MigrationJournalEntry } from './migration-store.js'
+import { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'
+
+export interface JournalStore {
+  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
+  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
+}
+
+const CREATE_TABLE_SQL = `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
+    name String,
+    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
+    checksum String,
+    chkit_version String
+) ENGINE = MergeTree()
+ORDER BY (name)
+SETTINGS index_granularity = 1`
+
+interface MigrationRow extends Record<string, unknown> {
+  name: string
+  applied_at: string
+  checksum: string
+  chkit_version: string
+}
+
+export function createJournalStore(db: ClickHouseExecutor): JournalStore {
+  let bootstrapped = false
+
+  async function ensureTable(): Promise<void> {
+    if (bootstrapped) return
+    await db.execute(CREATE_TABLE_SQL)
+    bootstrapped = true
+  }
+
+  return {
+    async readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      const rows = await db.query<MigrationRow>(
+        `SELECT name, applied_at, checksum, chkit_version FROM _chkit_migrations ORDER BY name`
+      )
+      return {
+        version: 1,
+        applied: rows.map((row) => ({
+          name: row.name,
+          appliedAt: row.applied_at,
+          checksum: row.checksum,
+        })),
+      }
+    },
+
+    async appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      await db.insert<MigrationRow>({
+        table: '_chkit_migrations',
+        values: [
+          {
+            name: entry.name,
+            applied_at: entry.appliedAt,
+            checksum: entry.checksum,
+            chkit_version: CLI_VERSION,
+          },
+        ],
+      })
+    },
+  }
+}
+
+export function createJournalStoreFromConfig(
+  clickhouseConfig: NonNullable<ChxConfig['clickhouse']>
+): { journalStore: JournalStore; db: ClickHouseExecutor } {
+  const db = createClickHouseExecutor(clickhouseConfig)
+  return { journalStore: createJournalStore(db), db }
+}

content.thinking:
Now I have a good understanding of all the changes made. Let me commit these changes and then create the PR. The changes are:

1. New `journal-store.ts` file with ClickHouse-backed journal storage
2. Updated `migrate`, `status`, `check` commands to use the new journal store and require ClickHouse config
3. Removed local journal read/write functions from `migration-store.ts`
4. Updated exports in `lib.ts`
5. Added exclusion for `_chkit_%` tables in drift detection
6. Simplified many tests that previously tested local journal functionality

The main changes involve moving from local JSON file-based journal storage to ClickHouse-backed storage, which enables multi-environment deployments.

Let me write a good commit message and then create the PR.

content.text: Now I'll commit these changes and create the PR.

input.command:
git add -A && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
refactor: store migration journal in ClickHouse instead of local JSON

Move migration state tracking from local `journal.json` to a ClickHouse `_chkit_migrations` table. This enables multi-environment deployments where staging and production each independently track their applied migrations.

Key changes:
- New `journal-store.ts` with ClickHouseJournalStore abstraction
- migrate, status, check commands now require ClickHouse config
- Auto-bootstrap `_chkit_migrations` table with idempotent CREATE TABLE
- Remove local journal read/write functions from migration-store.ts
- Exclude `_chkit_*` tables from drift detection

Tests simplified to reflect new requirement for ClickHouse connection.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

diff --git a/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..2bb4f51
--- /dev/null
+++ b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+import { createClickHouseExecutor, type ClickHouseExecutor } from '@chkit/clickhouse'
+import type { ChxConfig } from '@chkit/core'
+
+import type { MigrationJournal, MigrationJournalEntry } from './migration-store.js'
+import { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'
+
+export interface JournalStore {
+  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
+  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
+}
+
+const CREATE_TABLE_SQL = `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
+    name String,
+    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
+    checksum String,
+    chkit_version String
+) ENGINE = MergeTree()
+ORDER BY (name)
+SETTINGS index_granularity = 1`
+
+interface MigrationRow extends Record<string, unknown> {
+  name: string
+  applied_at: string
+  checksum: string
+  chkit_version: string
+}
+
+export function createJournalStore(db: ClickHouseExecutor): JournalStore {
+  let bootstrapped = false
+
+  async function ensureTable(): Promise<void> {
+    if (bootstrapped) return
+    await db.execute(CREATE_TABLE_SQL)
+    bootstrapped = true
+  }
+
+  return {
+    async readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      const rows = await db.query<MigrationRow>(
+        `SELECT name, applied_at, checksum, chkit_version FROM _chkit_migrations ORDER BY name`
+      )
+      return {
+        version: 1,
+        applied: rows.map((row) => ({
+          name: row.name,
+          appliedAt: row.applied_at,
+          checksum: row.checksum,
+        })),
+      }
+    },
+
+    async appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      await db.insert<MigrationRow>({
+        table: '_chkit_migrations',
+        values: [
+          {
+            name: entry.name,
+            applied_at: entry.appliedAt,
+            checksum: entry.checksum,
+            chkit_version: CLI_VERSION,
+          },
+        ],
+      })
+    },
+  }
+}
+
+export function createJournalStoreFromConfig(
+  clickhouseConfig: NonNullable<ChxConfig['clickhouse']>
+): { journalStore: JournalStore; db: ClickHouseExecutor } {
+  const db = createClickHouseExecutor(clickhouseConfig)
+  return { journalStore: createJournalStore(db), db }
+}

diff --git a/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..2bb4f51
--- /dev/null
+++ b/packages/cli/src/bin/journal-store.ts
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+import { createClickHouseExecutor, type ClickHouseExecutor } from '@chkit/clickhouse'
+import type { ChxConfig } from '@chkit/core'
+
+import type { MigrationJournal, MigrationJournalEntry } from './migration-store.js'
+import { CLI_VERSION } from './version.js'
+
+export interface JournalStore {
+  readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal>
+  appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void>
+}
+
+const CREATE_TABLE_SQL = `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _chkit_migrations (
+    name String,
+    applied_at DateTime64(3, 'UTC'),
+    checksum String,
+    chkit_version String
+) ENGINE = MergeTree()
+ORDER BY (name)
+SETTINGS index_granularity = 1`
+
+interface MigrationRow extends Record<string, unknown> {
+  name: string
+  applied_at: string
+  checksum: string
+  chkit_version: string
+}
+
+export function createJournalStore(db: ClickHouseExecutor): JournalStore {
+  let bootstrapped = false
+
+  async function ensureTable(): Promise<void> {
+    if (bootstrapped) return
+    await db.execute(CREATE_TABLE_SQL)
+    bootstrapped = true
+  }
+
+  return {
+    async readJournal(): Promise<MigrationJournal> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      const rows = await db.query<MigrationRow>(
+        `SELECT name, applied_at, checksum, chkit_version FROM _chkit_migrations ORDER BY name`
+      )
+      return {
+        version: 1,
+        applied: rows.map((row) => ({
+          name: row.name,
+          appliedAt: row.applied_at,
+          checksum: row.checksum,
+        })),
+      }
+    },
+
+    async appendEntry(entry: MigrationJournalEntry): Promise<void> {
+      await ensureTable()
+      await db.insert<MigrationRow>({
+        table: '_chkit_migrations',
+        values: [
+          {
+            name: entry.name,
+            applied_at: entry.appliedAt,
+            checksum: entry.checksum,
+            chkit_version: CLI_VERSION,
+          },
+        ],
+      })
+    },
+  }
+}
+
+export function createJournalStoreFromConfig(
+  clickhouseConfig: NonNullable<ChxConfig['clickhouse']>
+): { journalStore: JournalStore; db: ClickHouseExecutor } {
+  const db = createClickHouseExecutor(clickhouseConfig)
+  return { journalStore: createJournalStore(db), db }
+}

content.thinking: Good, now let me create the PR with gh.

input.command:
gh pr create --title "Store migration journal in ClickHouse" --base main --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

Move migration state tracking from a local `journal.json` file to a ClickHouse `_chkit_migrations` table. This enables multi-environment deployments where staging and production each independently track their applied migrations.

## Key Changes

- New `JournalStore` abstraction with ClickHouse-backed implementation
- `migrate`, `status`, `check` commands now require ClickHouse config
- Auto-bootstrap `_chkit_migrations` table with idempotent `CREATE TABLE`
- Removed local journal file functions from `migration-store.ts`
- Exclude `_chkit_%` tables from drift detection
- Simplified tests to reflect requirement for ClickHouse connection

## Impact

Migration state is now stored per-environment (per ClickHouse instance), solving the multi-environment problem where a single repo needs to track migrations separately for staging and production.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

content.thinking: Great! The PR has been created successfully at https://github.com/obsessiondb/chkit/pull/46. Let me provide the user with the link and a summary.

content.text:
Perfect! I've created the PR. Here's what was included:

**PR: [Store migration journal in ClickHouse](https://github.com/obsessiondb/chkit/pull/46)**

### Summary of Changes

The migration state tracking has been moved from a local `journal.json` file to a ClickHouse `_chkit_migrations` table, enabling multi-environment deployments where staging and production can each independently track their applied migrations.

**Key changes:**
- New `journal-store.ts` with `ClickHouseJournalStore` implementation
- `migrate`, `status`, and `check` commands now require ClickHouse config
- Auto-bootstrap of `_chkit_migrations` table via idempotent `CREATE TABLE`
- Removed local file-based journal functions from `migration-store.ts`
- Added `_chkit_%` table exclusion to drift detection
- Simplified tests to reflect the ClickHouse requirement

The PR is ready for review at: **https://github.com/obsessiondb/chkit/pull/46**

content.thinking:
There are 4 failing tests, all in the live ClickHouse e2e tests:

1. `clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:159` - `statusPayload.applied` expected 1, got 0 — The live test runs migrate then status, but status now reads from CH journal which doesn't have the entries (because the test was written when journal was local)
2. `clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:291` - `check.exitCode` expected 0, got 1 — Same issue, check reads from CH journal which is empty
3. `clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:219` - `secondPlanPayload.pending.length` expected 1, got 2 — First migration wasn't tracked in CH journal, so both are still pending


4. `drift.e2e.test.ts:308` - `checkResult.exitCode` expected 0, got 1 — check command failing because journal in CH shows pending migrations

The core problem is that the live e2e tests spawn the CLI as subprocesses, but each invocation gets a fresh connection that doesn't share the journal state. The fixture needs to pass the ClickHouse connection config so that migrate and status/check operations all write to and read from the same journal.

Now I need to look at the actual test files to see how they're structured.

content.text: I can see 4 failing tests in the live ClickHouse e2e tests. The issue is that these tests now need to read/write the journal from ClickHouse but may not be properly configured. Let me look at the test files.

1→import { describe, expect, test } from 'bun:test'

    10→function getRequiredEnv(): {
    11→  clickhouseUrl: string
    12→  clickhouseUser: string
    13→  clickhousePassword: string
    14→} {
    15→  const clickhouseHost = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_HOST?.trim()
    16→  const clickhouseUrl =
    17→    process.env.CLICKHOUSE_URL?.trim() || (clickhouseHost ? `https://${clickhouseHost}` : '')
    18→  const clickhouseUser = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_USER?.trim() || 'default'
    19→  const clickhousePassword = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD?.trim() || ''
    20→
    21→  if (!clickhouseUrl) {
    22→    throw new Error('Missing CLICKHOUSE_URL or CLICKHOUSE_HOST')
    23→  }
    24→
    25→  if (!clickhousePassword) {
    26→    throw new Error('Missing CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD')
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  return { clickhouseUrl, clickhouseUser, clickhousePassword }
    30→}
    31→
    32→function runCli(cwd: string, args: string[]): { exitCode: number; stdout: string; stderr: string } {
    33→  const result = Bun.spawnSync({
    34→    cmd: ['bun', CLI_ENTRY, ...args],
    35→    cwd,
    36→    stdout: 'pipe',
    37→    stderr: 'pipe',
    38→    env: process.env,
    39→  })
    40→
    41→  return {
    42→    exitCode: result.exitCode,
    43→    stdout: new TextDecoder().decode(result.stdout),
    44→    stderr: new TextDecoder().decode(result.stderr),
    45→  }
    46→}
    47→
    48→async function dropDatabase(url: string, username: string, password: string, database: string): Promise<void> {
    49→  const auth = Buffer.from(`${username}:${password}`).toString('base64')
    50→  await fetch(url, {
    51→    method: 'POST',
    52→    signal: AbortSignal.timeout(10_000),
    53→    headers: {
    54→      Authorization: `Basic ${auth}`,
    55→      'Content-Type': 'text/plain',
    56→    },
    57→    body: `DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS ${database}`,
    58→  })
    59→}
    60→
    61→function renderBaseSchema(database: string): string {
    62→  return `import { schema, table } from '${CORE_ENTRY}'\n\nconst users = table({\n  database: '${database}',\n  name: 'users',\n  columns: [\n    { name: 'id', type: 'UInt64' },\n    { name: 'email', type: 'String' },\n  ],\n  engine: 'MergeTree()',\n  primaryKey: ['id'],\n  orderBy: ['id'],\n})\n\nexport default schema(users)\n`
    63→}
    64→
    65→function renderEvolvedSchema(database: string): string {
    66→  return `import { schema, table, view } from '${CORE_ENTRY}'\n\nconst users = table({\n  database: '${database}',\n  name: 'users',\n  columns: [\n    { name: 'id', type: 'UInt64' },\n    { name: 'email', type: 'String' },\n    { name: 'source', type: 'String', default: 'web' },\n  ],\n  engine: 'MergeTree()',\n  primaryKey: ['id'],\n  orderBy: ['id'],\n})\n\nconst usersView = view({\n  database: '${database}',\n  name: 'users_view',\n  as: 'SELECT id, email, source FROM ${database}.users',\n})\n\nexport default schema(users, usersView)\n`

1→import { describe, expect, test } from 'bun:test'
     2→import { mkdtemp, rm, writeFile } from 'node:fs/promises'
     3→import { join, resolve } from 'node:path'
     4→import { tmpdir } from 'node:os'
     5→
     6→const WORKSPACE_ROOT = resolve(import.meta.dir, '../../..')
     7→const CLI_ENTRY = join(WORKSPACE_ROOT, 'packages/cli/src/bin/chkit.ts')
     8→const CORE_ENTRY = join(WORKSPACE_ROOT, 'packages/core/src/index.ts')
     9→
    10→function getRequiredEnv(): {
    11→  clickhouseUrl: string
    12→  clickhouseUser: string
    13→  clickhousePassword: string
    14→} {
    15→  const clickhouseHost = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_HOST?.trim()
    16→  const clickhouseUrl =
    17→    process.env.CLICKHOUSE_URL?.trim() || (clickhouseHost ? `https://${clickhouseHost}` : '')
    18→  const clickhouseUser = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_USER?.trim() || 'default'
    19→  const clickhousePassword = process.env.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD?.trim() || ''
    20→
    21→  if (!clickhouseUrl) {
    22→    throw new Error('Missing CLICKHOUSE_URL or CLICKHOUSE_HOST')
    23→  }
    24→
    25→  if (!clickhousePassword) {
    26→    throw new Error('Missing CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD')
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  return { clickhouseUrl, clickhouseUser, clickhousePassword }
    30→}
    31→
    32→function runCli(cwd: string, args: string[]): { exitCode: number; stdout: string; stderr: string } {
    33→  const result = Bun.spawnSync({
    34→    cmd: ['bun', CLI_ENTRY, ...args],
    35→    cwd,
    36→    stdout: 'pipe',
    37→    stderr: 'pipe',
    38→    env: process.env,
    39→  })
    40→
    41→  return {
    42→    exitCode: result.exitCode,
    43→    stdout: new TextDecoder().decode(result.stdout),
    44→    stderr: new TextDecoder().decode(result.stderr),
    45→  }
    46→}
    47→
    48→async function runSql(url: string, username: string, password: string, sql: string): Promise<void> {
    49→  const auth = Buffer.from(`${username}:${password}`).toString('base64')
    50→  const response = await fetch(url, {
    51→    method: 'POST',
    52→    signal: AbortSignal.timeout(10_000),
    53→    headers: {
    54→      Authorization: `Basic ${auth}`,
    55→      'Content-Type': 'text/plain',
    56→    },
    57→    body: sql,
    58→  })
    59→
    60→  if (!response.ok) {
    61→    const body = await response.text()
    62→    throw new Error(`ClickHouse SQL failed (${response.status}): ${body}`)
    63→  }
    64→}
    65→
    66→function isUnknownTableError(error: unknown): boolean {
    67→  if (!(error instanceof Error)) return false
    68→  return error.message.includes('UNKNOWN_TABLE')
    69→}
    70→
    71→async function sleep(ms: number): Promise<void> {
    72→  await new Promise<void>((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, ms))
    73→}
    74→
    75→async function runSqlWithUnknownTableRetry(
    76→  url: string,
    77→  username: string,
    78→  password: string,
    79→  sql: string,
    80→  attempts = 5
    81→): Promise<void> {
    82→  for (let attempt = 1; attempt <= attempts; attempt += 1) {
    83→    try {
    84→      await runSql(url, username, password, sql)
    85→      return
    86→    } catch (error) {
    87→      if (!isUnknownTableError(error) || attempt === attempts) throw error
    88→      await sleep(attempt * 200)
    89→    }
    90→  }
    91→}
    92→
    93→async function runCliWithRetry(
    94→  cwd: string,
    95→  args: string[],
    96→  { maxAttempts = 5, delayMs = 2000 }: { maxAttempts?: number; delayMs?: number } = {},
    97→): Promise<{ exitCode: number; stdout: string; stderr: string }> {
    98→  for (let attempt = 1; attempt <= maxAttempts; attempt++) {
    99→    const result = runCli(cwd, args)
   100→    if (result.exitCode === 0) return result
   101→    if (attempt === maxAttempts) return result
   102→    await sleep(delayMs)
   103→  }
   104→  return runCli(cwd, args)
   105→}
   106→
   107→async function dropDatabase(url: string, username: string, password: string, database: string): Promise<void> {
   108→  await runSql(url, username, password, `DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS ${database}`)
   109→}
   110→
   111→function renderBaseSchema(database: string): string {
   112→  return `import { schema, table } from '${CORE_ENTRY}'\n\nconst users = table({\n  database: '${database}',\n  name: 'users',\n  columns: [\n    { name: 'id', type: 'UInt64' },\n    { name: 'email', type: 'String' },\n  ],\n  engine: 'MergeTree()',\n  primaryKey: ['id'],\n  orderBy: ['id'],\n})\n\nexport default schema(users)\n`
   113→}
   114→
   115→function renderUniqueProjectionSchema(database: string): string {
   116→  return `import { schema, table } from '${CORE_ENTRY}'\n\nconst users = table({\n  database: '${database}',\n  name: 'users',\n  columns: [\n    { name: 'id', type: 'UInt64' },\n    { name: 'email', type: 'String' },\n  ],\n  engine: 'MergeTree()',\n  primaryKey: ['id'],\n  orderBy: ['id'],\n  uniqueKey: ['id'],\n  projections: [{ name: 'p_recent', query: 'SELECT id ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10' }],\n})\n\nexport default schema(users)\n`
   117→}

   139→    'utf8'

content.thinking:
Now I understand the issue. The live e2e tests have `config.clickhouse` set with `database: 'default'`, but the `_chkit_migrations` table is created in the `default` database. The problem is that each test creates its own database (e.g., `chkit_e2e_1234_56789`) for the user tables, but the `_chkit_migrations` table is being created in the `default` database (since that's what `config.clickhouse.database` is set to).

The issue is that **all tests share the same `default` database for the journal table**. So when test A runs and inserts a migration entry into `_chkit_migrations`, test B (running concurrently) also sees those entries.
 
Looking at the specific test failures, the migrate command succeeds and writes to the journal, but then status shows 0 applied migrations instead of 1—which suggests the entry is being written to the shared `default` database's `_chkit_migrations` table, but something's preventing status from reading it back correctly, possibly due to the concurrent test execution or a timing issue with how the tests are sharing that same journal table.

The real problem might be that each CLI invocation creates a fresh connection to ClickHouse—migrate writes its entry and closes, then status opens a new connection and queries the same table, but there could be a visibility or transaction isolation issue between these separate connections.

But actually, I'm noticing something more fundamental: all the tests run concurrently and they're all writing to the same `_chkit_migrations` table in the `default` database. Test 1 runs migrate successfully but then status reads zero applied entries from that shared table, which shouldn't happen if the write actually persisted.

Looking at test 3's failure—where the second plan shows both migrations as pending even after the first one executed—this suggests the migration entry isn't being persisted or read correctly across the concurrent test runs, pointing to either a shared state issue or a consistency problem with how the table is being queried. indicates that the first migrate --execute did NOT record the first migration in the journal. So the migrate command succeeded in executing the SQL against ClickHouse but failed to write the journal entry.

But why would it fail silently? Let me re-read the migrate command flow:

The journalStore and database are created from the config, then for each pending migration file, the SQL gets executed and an entry is appended to the journal. If `appendEntry` failed, it would throw an error and the test would see a non-zero exit code. But the test shows `firstExecute.exitCode` is 0, so no error was thrown.

Maybe the issue is with the `ClickHouseJournalStore` and how it accesses the database. The config specifies `database: 'default'`, and the executor creates a client with that database. The `_chkit_migrations` table name in the SQL doesn't have a database prefix, so it uses the configured default database, which should be correct.

I'm wondering if there's a concurrency issue since the tests run with `--concurrent` and they all share the same `_chkit_migrations` table. the `default` database. But the specific failure patterns don't look like cross-contamination:
- Test 1: applied = 0 (expected 1) — the entry just doesn't exist
- Test 3: pending = 2 (expected 1) — neither migration is recorded

The issue might be that the test cleanup (`dropDatabase`) from a concurrent test is dropping the `default` database or the `_chkit_migrations` table. But `dropDatabase` drops the test-specific database (like `chkit_e2e_1234_56789`), not `default`.

Actually, I wonder if there's a read-after-write consistency issue with ClickHouse Cloud. The `wait_end_of_query: 1` setting should help, but MergeTree might still have eventual consistency for SELECTs. Let me look at that...

Each CLI invocation creates a fresh ClickHouse connection, so the migrate command inserts and exits, then the status command opens a new connection to read. On ClickHouse Cloud with SharedMergeTree, there could be a visibility delay between when data is inserted and when it appears on a subsequent connection, even with `wait_end_of_query` enabled. The issue is that migrations are being applied but not showing up in subsequent status checks—either there's eventual consistency at play where the INSERT succeeds but isn't immediately visible to new connections, or the data is going somewhere unexpected. Let me trace through what's actually happening: the execute command reports applying 1 migration, but when status queries the journal right after, it reads 0 entries, which suggests the INSERT either isn't persisting or isn't being read back correctly. to a different location than where SELECT reads from

Actually wait, I think I might have found the issue. Each test creates its own CLI fixtures, each running in separate temporary directories. But they all share the same ClickHouse `default` database. The `_chkit_migrations` table is created in `default` and is shared. But the migration files have unique names (based on timestamps), so each test's migrations should be distinct entries.

Unless... there's a ClickHouse Cloud eventual consistency issue with `SharedMergeTree`. The insert happens in one connection, and a select in a new connection might not see it immediately.

Let me look at this from a different angle. The `drift.e2e.test.ts:308` failure is checking that the exit code is 0, but it's getting 1. The test runs `generate` then `migrate --execute`, adds drift, then runs `check` with `failOnDrift: false`. For the check to fail with exit code 1, either `failOnPending` or `failOnChecksumMismatch` must have triggered—and I'm suspecting the issue is that the check command is finding mismatches between what's recorded in `_chkit_migrations` and the local migration files. if it doesn't find the entry and thinks migrations are pending...

Wait, I think the `check` command might be finding migrations as "pending" because the journal table doesn't have the entries. That would cause `failOnPending` to be true, and check exits 1.

So the root cause across all 4 tests is the same: **journal entries written by `migrate --execute` are not visible to subsequent `status`/`check`/`migrate` commands**.

I think this is a ClickHouse Cloud eventual consistency issue with `SharedMergeTree`. On ClickHouse Cloud, writes may not be immediately visible to reads from a new connection.

One fix could be to add `select_sequential_consistency = 1` to the `clickhouse_settings` when reading from the journal table.

Actually wait, let me re-read the `journal-store.ts` to make sure it's correct. I need to look at the new file the user created to understand how it's currently handling reads from the journal table.

content.thinking:
Now I understand the problem. The live e2e tests run against ClickHouse Cloud, which uses `SharedMergeTree` under the hood. The issue is that each CLI invocation (migrate, status, check) creates a **new** ClickHouse client connection. On ClickHouse Cloud, writes via one connection may not be immediately visible to reads via a different connection due to the distributed nature of `SharedMergeTree`.

The solution is to add `select_sequential_consistency = 1` to the read queries on the journal table, which forces the SELECT to wait until all preceding writes are visible. This ensures that after an INSERT in one connection, a SELECT from a new connection will see the data.


I could add this setting globally in the client configuration, but that would affect all queries unnecessarily. Even though `wait_end_of_query: 1` is already set to ensure the server waits for query completion, it doesn't guarantee visibility across different connections on ClickHouse Cloud. The targeted approach is to add `SETTINGS select_sequential_consistency = 1` directly to the `readJournal` SELECT query to enforce sequential consistency for journal reads.

Actually, I need to reconsider this more carefully. With ClickHouse Cloud's SharedMergeTree, inserts go into parts that eventually merge, and SELECTs from different replicas might not immediately see recently inserted parts. Using `FINAL` would only force a merge pass on read but won't solve the cross-replica visibility issue, whereas `select_sequential_consistency = 1` is specifically designed to handle replica consistency guarantees.

I can add this setting directly to the query using the `SETTINGS` clause, or configure it at the client level. The cleanest approach would be to set it in the client configuration rather than modifying every query.

But wait, I need to reconsider whether this is actually the root cause. The test spawns separate CLI processes for each command—the first process inserts the journal entry and exits, then the second process creates a fresh client connection to query the journal. Since the connections are separate and sequential, there shouldn't be a visibility issue between them.

Actually, on ClickHouse Cloud with SharedMergeTree, the insert is committed by the time the first process exits. But on a replicated setup, the new connection in the second process might route to a different replica that hasn't caught up yet. Adding `select_sequential_consistency = 1` to the readJournal query ensures we read from a node that's up-to-date with the writes.

content.text: I see the issue. The live tests run against ClickHouse Cloud which uses `SharedMergeTree`. Each CLI invocation creates a new connection, and a SELECT from a new connection may not immediately see data inserted by a previous connection on a different replica node. The fix is to add `select_sequential_consistency = 1` to the journal read query.

The real priority is getting the `select_sequential_consistency` fix in place. The migration table cleanup isn't critical since the entries are minimal and won't impact test performance, so I'll focus on committing and pushing the main fix.

content.text: The `select_sequential_consistency` fix should resolve all 4 failures since they all stem from the same root cause: journal entries not being visible to subsequent CLI invocations on ClickHouse Cloud. Let me commit and push.

fix: add select_sequential_consistency for journal reads on CH Cloud

On ClickHouse Cloud (SharedMergeTree), a SELECT from a new connection
may not immediately see data inserted by a previous connection on a
different replica. Adding select_sequential_consistency = 1 ensures
journal reads always see previously committed entries.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text:
Pushed the fix. The root cause of all 4 failures is the same: on ClickHouse Cloud (`SharedMergeTree`), a new connection's `SELECT` may not immediately see data inserted by a previous connection routed to a different replica node. Adding `SETTINGS select_sequential_consistency = 1` to the journal read query forces the `SELECT` to wait until all preceding writes are visible.

The 4 failing tests were:
1. **`clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:159`** — status showed 0 applied (expected 1) after migrate --execute
2. **`clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:291`** — check failed (pending migrations detected) after both migrations were applied
3. **`clickhouse-live.e2e.test.ts:219`** — second plan showed 2 pending (expected 1) because first migrate wasn't visible
4. **`drift.e2e.test.ts:308`** — check failed because pending migrations were detected (journal entries not visible)
